results.name: Triangle read by rows in which row n consists of the first n+1 n-gonal numbers.
link: T. D. Noe, Rows n = 0..100 of triangle, flattened
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Polygonal Number
formula: Array of coefficients of x in the expansions of T(k, x) = (1 + k*x -(k-2)*x^2)/(1-x)^4, k > -4.
T(n, k) = k*((n-2)*k -(n-4))/2 (see MathWorld link). - _Michel Marcus_, Jun 22 2015
mathematica: Table[PolygonalNumber[n,i],{n,0,10},{i,n+1}]//Flatten (* Requires Mathematica version 10.4 or later *) (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Aug 27 2016 *)
program: (PARI) tabl(nn) = {for (n=0, nn, for (k=1, n+1, print1(k*((n-2)*k-(n-4))/2, ", ");); print(););} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Jun 22 2015
(Sage) [[k*((n-2)*k -(n-4))/2 for k in (1..n+1)] for n in (0..10)] # _G. C. Greubel_, Aug 14 2019
xref: Antidiagonals are composed of n-gonal numbers.
